itemDescription: Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross

wikipedia_page.main: John Paton VC (23 December 1833 – 1 April 1914) was a Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: :*Sergeant John Paton, awarded in Indian Mutiny

link_mentions.page: List of Scottish Victoria Cross recipients

response: * John Paton (1833–1914), winner of the Victoria Cross for bravery in India in 1857; a Summer Hill park is named after him.
